string.text: Individual Limbs and Main Health System

You just used an item to heal yourself. However healing in GAMMA is a bit more complex than just using medkits.
 
 • Your health is divided in several individual health pools:
 | - Main Health (character icon). 
 | - Individual limbs health. 
 | - Psy health. 
 • You die if your Main Health reaches 0, if your Head Health reaches 0, if your Torso Health reaches 0 or if your Psy Health reaches 0.
 • The Legs and Arms bars have various effects when being depleted: 
 | - Damaged arms make your aim shake. 
 | - Damaged legs slow you down and deals damage to your Main Health when running on a broken leg.

• Main Health can be healed using items which display a red heart icon, this mainly includes: 
 | - Medkits (slow health recovery). 
 | - Stimpacks (fast health recovery). 
 | - Artefacts, Pelts and Belt Items with passive health regeneration properties. 
 

• The higher the rank of the Medkit or the Stimpack, the better the health recovery.

%c[ui_white]• Limb health pools contain two types of health:
 | - %c[d_orange]Temporary Limb Health%c[ui_white] (in yellow), which gradually reduces with time.
 | - %c[ui_gray_2]Permanent Limb Health%c[ui_white] (in white).
 • %c[d_orange]Temporary Limb Health%c[ui_white] is restored with using First-Aid items displaying a red heart icon, like Bandages, Medkits, Stimpacks...
 • %c[d_orange]Temporary Limb Health%c[ui_white] can be converted to %c[ui_gray_2]Permanent Limb Health%c[ui_white] using Post-Heal items displaying a white heart icon, like Yadulin, Antidote, Ibuprofen... 
 • Limbs Health restoration thus works by using a First-Aid item (ex: Bandage) followed by a Post-Heal item (ex: Ibuprofen).
 • The details of %c[d_orange]Temporary Limb Health%c[ui_white] restoration and %c[ui_gray_2]Permanent Limb Health%c[ui_white] conversion for each item is detailed in the item description. 
 • The %c[d_orange]Temporary Limb Health%c[ui_white] is consumed before the %c[ui_gray_2]Permanent Limb Health%c[ui_white]. Thus, during fights, simply use bandages until the fight ends, and then convert the %c[d_orange]Temporary Limb Health%c[ui_white] to %c[ui_gray_2]Permanent Limb Health%c[ui_white].

• When receiving damages, there's a probability that the fresh wounds bleed. Bleeding is indicated by a blood droplet icon on the HUD. The stronger the bleed, the more red the icon outline will be (white > yellow > red).
 

• Bleeds must be treated fast since they aggravate and deal a lot of damage overtime. They can be treated using: 
 | - Bandage (slow bleed heal). 
 | - Tourniquet (fast bleed heal). 
 | - Artefacts, Pelts and Belt Items passive bleed heal properties. 
 

• Certain artefacts have negative bleed recovery, that needs to be counter balanced with positive bleed recovery, otherwise any bleed will quickly aggravate.

Certain enemies can deal damages to your brain through psi emissions (like Controllers). Items increasing your Psy Resistance also restore your Psy Health. These items display an icon with blue waves, this includes: 
 | - Psy-block. 
 | - Sleeping Pills. 
 | - Etperazine. 
 | - Marijuana and joints. 
 | - Certain beverages. 
 | - Artefacts. 
 

%c[yellow]You can see this tutorial again by going into Mod Config Menu (MCM) > NPE Modules > G.A.M.M.A. and unticking the tutorial.
